meta.name: description
meta.content: Wilkes County Schools serves students in PreK-13 and is located in North Wilkesboro, NC.

div.p: Governor Cooper's recent announcement has closed school buildings across the state for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Wilkes County Schools will continue Remote Learning through May 29th, which is the end of the academic year. This will be best in order to prepare your child for success at their next grade level. Please click the article headline above or the "Read More" link for more details.

div.h2: Be sure to check out the current edition of our WCS District Newsletter. There are many events highlighted from several schools across Wilkes County. Enjoy!

div.a: Read More About Wilkes County Schools»

img.alt: Updates Amid Coronavirus Closings Thumbnail Image

article.div: Governor Cooper's recent announcement has closed school buildings across the state for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Wilkes County Schools will continue Remote Learning through May 29th, which is the end of the academic year. This will be best in order to prepare your child for success at their next grade level. Please click the article headline above or the "Read More" link for more details.

img.alt: Información en español sobre el Coronavirus Thumbnail Image

h1.a: Información en español sobre el Coronavirus

article.div: Toda las actualizaciones sobre el impacto del Coronavirus en nuestras escuelas del sistema educativo de Wilkes los puede encontrar aquí. Haga click en el articulo para ver todos los enlaces.

img.alt: FAQs Regarding End-of-Year Grading Thumbnail Image

article.div: The NC State Board of Education recently approved guidelines regarding end-of-year grading and student promotion for Spring 2020. It will be important for students and families to understand these changes. Click the headline of this article to access their FAQs and explore the WCS Grading Guidelines and Remote Learning Resources.

Wilkes County Schools will offer breakfast and lunch service beginning Tuesday, March 17, 2020. Our Sites will serve children between 1 and 18 years of age. Meals are available at each school site with the exception of Wilkes Early College High School and Wilkes Central, and they may be picked up through the car line. Click the headline above for more information.

The Transportation Department is currently collecting information regarding bus ridership for the 2020-2021 school year. Please click the headline above to complete the online form if your student needs bus transportation NEXT year. Requests will close June 1, 2020.

Click the headline of this article to learn more about the Remote Learning Plan for Wilkes County Schools. This section includes remote learning plans for our school district, grading guidelines, and helpful resources for schools and families.
